with a differential equation. So key point here
in this lecture is how do you start with

essentially negative

And notice we have

at the other end it's zero.

So this is fixed-fixed. And it's a boundary
value problem.

That's different from an
initial value problem. We have x space, not time.

So we're not starting
from some thing and oscillating or growing
or decaying in time.

We have a fixed thing. Think of an elastic bar. An elastic bar
